Reviews.Title: “Horrible Experience---DONT STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: jodi032
Reviews.Content: The Airways Inn & Suites is one of the most disgusting places. I call it the ARM PIT of Miami. I cannot even give this motel a "one star" due to its complete unsatisfactory situation. The first room we received had so much mold on the ceiling, it was black. And a huge pole in the middle of the room that was very smelly, unclean and unacceptable. The second room had 3 spots of mold on the bathroom ceiling and had so many things wrong with it, we have taken pictures and will post them online. I booked 3 rooms and paid $54 per room, other guests in the hall said they paid--for the same rooms $40, $45 and $80. broken window frames, cockroaches dead in hall way, huge bug splattered on wall, cracks in walls, mold completely around tub, bottom of tub black, rust all over light fixture in bathroom, only one wash cloth and when asked for second one--they said--we don't have any more. In the AM, we ventured down the street and found a Comfort Inn and Suites that will be the place we stay from now on. oh, forgot--from outside, the lobby and the outside of the pool area, looks like an ok place, i guess if you get some of their "newer" rooms--at $129 each they might be better but garbage at bottom of pool. So disappointed at our stay, the rude staff and the filth. I will do my best to make sure all of my clients and anyone else does not ever stay here. I have had to mark a star rating but there isn't a minus rating-they would by -5 stars

Reviews.Title: “Airport convenience and price are the only reason for staying here.”
Reviews.Author: Jay2883
Reviews.Content: The room has a faint smell of mold/mildew. The carpets are in desparate need of shampooing. The ceiling has cracks and stains. The walls are flaking and paper thin. The furniture is falling apart. In severe need of renovations! The pool area is nice along with the front desk associate being friendly. The location to the airport is key.

Reviews.Title: “Steer clear of this place”
Reviews.Author: Ginger383
Reviews.Content: Don't stay at this Inn! We paid $95 for this disgusting place and would have rather slept on the floor at the airport. The hallways that lead to your room are frightful...dirty walls and filthy buckled carpet. The walk down the hallway was almost scary! Opening the door to our room, the smell of mold overwhelmed us. Even my husband who can handle smells could hardly sleep in this room. The bathroom was even more disgusting with black mildew/mold coloring the grout and caulking. I can not believe they can get away with selling these rooms!

Reviews.Title: “worst stay after crusie”
Reviews.Author: a j
Reviews.Content: horrible horrible room!!!! dont listen to your spouses to save a few bucks!!! its horrible... i can't believe we had to pay 100 dollars for a single night for this hotel....

Reviews.Title: “Stranded on New Year's Eve”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a cheaprooms.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Roomy room. Bath was huge! Be careful, though. Tub and floor are not even. Opposite wall stopped me from a VERY dangerous fall getting out. Breakfast was sufficient. Staff were responsive. ________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________

Reviews.Title: “Dreadful!!”
Reviews.Author: keithjat
Reviews.Content: Overnight stay before a cruise. I've stayed in some bad hotels before but thought this 2 Star listed, would be ok for a night. WRONG!!!!! Hallways very dirty, room old and run down. Carpets threadbare, sink did not drain and looked like there was mold growing in the shower! If our flight hadn't arrived so late, we would have packed up and gone to a different place. HOW IN THE WORLD IS THIS A 2 STAR HOTEL???? Very disapointing experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for the price...”
Reviews.Author: Pannipannini
Reviews.Content: I rated the hotel excellent because for the price and value this place was right on. We stayed here one night because of a layover in Miami, with a family of four (including a toddler and a grandparent). Here is why Goldilocks would call this hotel "just right": *Staff was friendly and the shuttle picked us up as needed *the room was clean (sheets clean, shower/bathroom clean, towels clean, carpet clean, kitchen area clean) *carpet vacuumed and neat *kitchen area clean (fridge and sink tidy) *beds and pillows comfortable *breakfast was very simple (bagels, cream cheese, bread, coffee, juice) *AC worked well *pool area very nice (I wish we could have taken advantage of it) So for one night - who in their right mind would pay more than $80? When you think about it, running a place like this costs money (overhead, staff, taxes, power, gasoline for the van, laundry etc.). These days, $80 provides simple and appropriate accommodations, nothing more. For another $50+ you can stay elsewhere. Having traveled in many places, backpacked/camped, I would be more than comfortable staying here for a week even. But to each his own, I suppose.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best hotel in Miami”
Reviews.Author: Simonest
Reviews.Content: This hotel is close to the airport and offer free shuttle nd free internet in common area, not in the rooms. The room is really old, the carpet, the walls and bathroom is not great and the AC has a terriblle noise.... The swimming pool is busy and noisy too... My advice is try to find something better surround.

Reviews.Title: “Worst then a NIGHTMARE”
Reviews.Author: maureenColumbia_SC
Reviews.Content: This place sales you on the price but when you get their you will want to hurt the person who reccomended this place. They are saleing you the worst part of this hotel; which smells terrible,paint peeling of walls, tub so dirty cleaning will not help,walls are cracked, and mole growning everywhereforget the bed just nasty. Then when you refuse to saty in the room, they tell you they have other rooms which will cost you more, this is the new side of the hotel, but wait it look 100% better but still have problems. I refused three other room they tried to give us on the nasty side. We didn't have any choice because they already charged our card prior to arrival so we had to up-grad at a cost to us, the room was very nice but then it happen water dripping from vent over my toilet it was brown and nasty when we called the front desk they refuse to send any one to help us,but offered towels to wip it up .They wouldn't even give us some cleansupply to clean off the toilt. Run dont stay at this place BIG SCAMMMMM

Reviews.Title: “Worst Nightmare!!!”
Reviews.Author: OpaOma_11
Reviews.Content: Don't even think of staying here! I stayed for one night and it was my worst nightmare, everything is nasty. The bed, the carpet, the grounds, the pool,and the worst was the bathroom!!! I never slept a wink, I sat in a chair for the entire night. I was in this hotel at about 8pm and out buy 7Am! Simply put..... Don't stay here, not even if it is FREE!

Reviews.Title: “Never Again!!!”
Reviews.Author: Lio P
Reviews.Content: Airways Inn and Suites in Miami Springs, Fl is by far the worst Inn I have ever stayed in. I was so diappointed in Expedia for offering this facility as a viable option. I thought Expedia was reputable enough that I could trust it with this offer, but I was wrong. The place was decrepit and I may never use expedia again to book a trip. The walls and carpets were falling apart and dirty. The bathrooms walls were full of cracks and patches, the televisions did not work. I stayed in two rooms because I demanded I be moved to a better room after my first night. I will never ever stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Forget it!”
Reviews.Author: YleniaY
Reviews.Content: This motel is the worst I have ever seen in Florida! It is really really dirty! The rooms and the bathroom are awful, dirty and old. The room door was broken, the wc was broken, the shower was broken. The only 2 positive things are the location (very close to the airport with free shuttle service) and the service (people at the reception are really nice).

Reviews.Title: “Gross”
Reviews.Author: qtpie815
Reviews.Content: We stayed here to make an early morning connectin. BIG mistake it was disgusting. Moldy smelling room. SO outdated and run down. Any second I thought people were going to bust in and kill us. The bathroom was dirty. I think a concrete floor would have been more confortable then the bed. But then again, looking back, I think it might have been uncomfortable because I slept fully clothed, from head to toe, even with a hooded sweatshirt on and the hood over my head so that my body would not touch that filthy disgusting bed. Even being that I was only in the room about 6 hours, it was 6 hours of pure torture. Do not even bother. If you need someplace to crash for a morning connection, do not make the same mistake I did. The ONLY good thing was the free shuttle back to the airport. That is the only good thing I can think of.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for one night - breakfast at the pool was nice”
Reviews.Author: dasali
Reviews.Content: We needed a room for just one night close to the airport in Miami. As others mentioned, the rooms aren't really clean. Was good enough for a couple of hours of jetlagged sleep ... Breakfast was surprisingly good. They seem to have recently installed a seating area right at the pool. Would recommend this for people with similar needs. I wouldn't want to stay for a longer period.

Reviews.Title: “Don't choose this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: carib_cricri
Reviews.Content: We had chosen this hotel because of it's location (close to the airport) and because it had a shuttle service, and it was in the Florida rough guide. We only stayed one night (thank goodness) leaving Florida the next day by plane. The lady at the reception was nice, but the hotel.... We had rooms on the ground floor, two double queen bed rooms, one happened to have a kitchenette. Allready when we walked down the coridor to the rooms I wondered were we had landed... The hotel is clearly not maintained, with worn down paint, doors with big marks, bad lightning in the corridor... The rooms were spacious, but again gave the impression of 'old and not clean'; bedsheets with holes/toren/ripped/stained, a wall-to-wall carpet I didn't feel like looking into. And the top of the top: cockroaches! Two in my husbands room at night (killed and flushed down the toilet), two in the morning (same treatment)!!!! I regret I didn't take a picture to show. When we told the frontdesk upon leaving at 6am, wanting a rebate or even a full refund of at least one room, the man said he didn't have the authority etc etc. and that the hotel had been fumigated a week before! Well, if that is true it wasn't well done! My advice: go somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Don't Bother”
Reviews.Author: total_loss26
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because it offered free, protected parking. it was NOT worth it. The hotel has seen better days, the carpet is in serious need of replacing, the walls have cracks in them, the road noise is bad, the sheets did not fit the bed and kept coming off at night, the water heater was broken (cold shower in the morning), the phone was broken (could not call the front desk to report hot water problem), and when we reported it at check out, they acted like they did not have a clue what I was saying. We should have stayed on South Beach and paid the parking.

Reviews.Title: “STAY AWAY FROM AIRWAYS!”
Reviews.Author: missannenyc
Reviews.Content: I picked up my friend a week before at another hotel and, as we cruised by the Airways Inn and Suites, he laughed and said, "Thank God, I didn't stay there!" With all hotels near the airport fully booked the following Saturday night and with 6 am departures the next morning, we had no other option than to stay at Airways Inn. Little did we know how right he would be. After a quick check-in, we cruised down the main hallway up the stairs to the left, as the front desk instructed, to get to our room. With no signs to direct us, we asked a maintenance man for directions in Spanish. He told us to exit the building, walk through a parking lot, enter another building, and go up a flight of stairs to find our room. Ok... Once in the room, there are no options for bedding, e.g. two doubles, a queen, king. You get a double. Three people, a double and a single. We pulled off the polyester bed cover, checked the linens for stains, and pulled up the mattress for signs of bedbugs. We soon learned that there is no such thing as housekeeping for fresh sheets, pillows, blankets, towels. The television was circa 1991 and more static than clarity. The shower was a trickle of water at best, with the occasional drop of heat. Paint peels off the walls inside and outside the rooms. At least our flip flops didn't stick to any of the flooring. Also, the hotel shuttle does not run 24 hours a day as advertised! Walking down our hallway, the card key lock had been removed from one room's door and through the holes we could see that it was occupied. Read drug den. The halls smelled of all kinds of smoke. Not wanting to spend any more time than necessary in our room, we asked the front desk about restaurant options. She mentioned the bar/restaurant in the hotel. Right. The back side of the restaurant, the kitchen and dish-washing area, opens into the main hotel hallway and is enough negative advertising for the place. The inside doesn't offer much to better the impression. Other than that, the front desk mentioned the three fast food chains within walking distance. No, thank you. BEWARE OF AIRWAYS INN AND SUITES! This "inn" looks more like a crime scene than accommodation and should be available for walk-ins by the hour only.

Reviews.Title: “HEALTH HAZARD”
Reviews.Author: Jameschapter1
Reviews.Content: Was on a mission trip to Haiti and stayed to save money. Will stay on airport floor befor I ever go back to this place. A/c was out, room molded, no towels, etc. Could not sleep all night due to drunks from bar and working girls !!

Reviews.Title: “Hands down the worst ever!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jcrossSanFrancisco
Reviews.Content: I wanted a "cheap" place to crash for a night by the airport. Here's what I got: $135/night for a single, which was a bargain since with was the only MIA hotel in the area for under $400---everything sold out. The shuttle runs on the hour. Thus, if you miss it you will wait a full hour for it to return to take you the 1.5 miles. The free wireless is not in the rooms.....and not even in the lobby since their modum was 'acting up." But, none of this really counts compared to how downright nasty this place is. I spent 7 hour there total trying to sleep in a room saturated with kitchen smells-grease, etc. right on a busy road with old single pane windows across from the airport. Noisy like you can't imagin! Everything in the room was old an broked and dirty. It was seriously the most disgusting place I have ever seen and I haveback packed through multiple countries. There is no elevator so you have to walk up these creeking worn out old stps and then down a hall way with loose electricle wires sprouting out from the walls. It's like a scene from a B rated horror movie. Oh, let's not forget the lumpy beds and pillows thin sheets with stains from god knows what on them and a shower so disgusting that I left 4 hours before my flight to go shower and clean up at the Admiral's Club. You cannot even believe the amount of rust, stains and missing tiles, etc. in that bathroom! I felt sorry for al the nice looking older couples from overseas who were there-----not a good impression of the US! In fact, the crowd was a very good one---obviously we all fell prey to the lure of the "cheap" hotel with rooms on a day when everything was sold out. They need to raze this place and s tart over. NExt time I will sleep in the terminal rather than stay in this place!

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: MrmrEm01
Reviews.Content: Stayed in many hotels along the way and can safely say this wins the award for worst. Felt dirty and unsafe all night. Did not dare shower and glad flying home next day.

Reviews.Title: “Stay of a life time”
Reviews.Author: Sweet_Peper_Jelly
Reviews.Content: How do I describe our stay at Airport Airway Inn and Suites.... We are from Northern Maine, and don't have all the nice commodities, of the big city. But this Inn gave us everything we could ask for. With loose hanging power outlets, vomit stained and pubic hair filled sheets and latex (pealing) paint walls it was a great stay away from home. With the freshly painted bath tub (that was pealing and clogging the drain) and the (cold) hot water it was a great. Our T.V. set also doubled as a police scanner. In the morning, heading down the 2 foot wide stairway that was covered with cigarette buts and dirty diapers, we could smell and could not wait for our complimentary breakfast. We were happy to see, an amazing spread, of toast. Yes toast. They also had a great selection of invisible coffee, jelly plates and tables to sit. All in all I would totally (not) recommend this Inn to any self respecting person. Take my advice and seek other places to stay. Advice to everyone who decides to stay here, leave your bags in the room, and enjoy the bar next door (which made sure to tell us it was not affiliated to the Inn).

Reviews.Title: “Take heed-the reviews are the truth”
Reviews.Author: 102warrior
Reviews.Content: Flew into the airport and told the cab driver to take me to a budget motel....After finding the days in full I hoofed it a few blocks to the airway inn.....Big mistake. For the same price you can get a nice hotel on the beach 20 minutes away! That place is trashy all around. First room they put us in must have been for the local talent, no hallway light at the end of that hall and the air conditioner didn't work which would have been fine if the windows had screens. I was worried about leaving them open since the door looked like it had been kicked in at one point. Got another room which wasn't much better. That's the last time I stay there and I urge everyone else to follow my lead! I did find one nice place that I would recommend. The new Casablanca in miami beach, same price but it's a resort compared to airway in

Reviews.Title: “Hide Yo Kids, Hide Yo Wife!!!”
Reviews.Author: Philde04
Reviews.Content: There isn't enough room to describe how bad this hotel was. We were checking in and there were two naked kids running around swimming in the pool, then we look and one of them is poop beside the pool. It stayed there for quite sometime. The room was disguisting and the door wasn't very secure. NASTY is an understatment. It looked like a room that prostitutes use!! Spend the extra $20 a night and stay at the Holiday Inn Express.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy & Deceptive Advertising!”
Reviews.Author: SafeMom
Reviews.Content: I was appaulled that a hotel like this exists. BIG mistake on choosing them from the Ad board with phones, at Miami airport. But every other hotel was full. I am shocked that they are even allowed to advertise at the airport! We took the hotel, without looking of course, thinking that at least they had a large pool. When we arrived, we were upset to see that the pool wasn't even clean. Never saw anyone check the water, or even skim the dead leaves, film, and insects from it. No one dared swim in it! The hallways were depressing, and downright frightening. Wet, stained, dirty carpet and walls. We had no choice, it was late night, and to go out on their roadway location, looked dangerous. The room we got was dirty, the bathroom with leaking pipes and full of mold. Water ran constantly, and so the room was humid and musty. Rotted wood peeled off. We were charged, with no choice, for an old safe bolted in the room, that was totally unusable. Also, we were billed for a 'micro-fridge', that was non-existent. It rained, and water poured into the common hallways, like a flood. We literally had to walk through the dirty water, to get in and out of the place! Continental breakfast? Dry sliced white bread, with a pat of butter. Black coffee, not even any milk for it. Felt like I was in prison. Nothing for kids, no juice, no milk, no cereal. BUT the little 'adjoining' store had bottles of water....for $4! I was afraid to ask the price of a juice, after that quote. We walked to a gas station, and gladly bought ourselves a decent breakfast & drink. The internet is only available in their reception hallway. So people had to crowd in their on the few chairs they had, to use it. We are seasoned travelers, have been all over the world. But I have never seen anything like this in my life. I would not even give one star, but had to at least put one, to enter this comment. PLEASE, sleep at the airport, if this is your only choice! Beware, the internet site I researched afterwards, is totally deceptive. It made hell, look like paradise* ( Just wish I had taken photos, to post!)

Reviews.Title: “would not ever stay there again”
Reviews.Author: nhappycustomer
Reviews.Content: this hotel should not be listed anywhere for people to stay it is listed with hotelrewards they need to drop it quickly it is a disgrace it is nasty,it stinks, thebathrooms are a mess hanging wires in some of the rooms bugs there is not anything good to say about this place as a travel agent i did find better accommadations for my clients and myself i will never ever recommend this hotel to anyone. i hope the word will spread you want a rating on what !!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “One look and I left to another hotel.”
Reviews.Author: travelpro231
Reviews.Content: I was looking for an inexpensive place near the airport since I was only in Miami one night. As I approached the hotel (dump is more like it) I knew this was not for me. I did not feel safe here. The clerk did not have my reservation (thank god) and I went to the Holiday Inn down the street. The lobby of the Airways was in very poor condition. I would not let an animal stay at this hotel. Spend the extra bucks to stay someplace clean and safe. I can only imagine what the rooms were like. If they cannot spend any money to fix this up (my guess is the last renovation was in the 70's) they should demolish it! I still got charged for the stay since I booked through Expedia (shame on them) and see that this must be how they make their money (double or triple booking the same rooms). RUN, don't walk from this place!

Reviews.Title: “Night of hell”
Reviews.Author: sbteam1
Reviews.Content: Do not go near the place. Wires exposed. Brown water, sink coming out of the wall. Carpet was disgusting. 3 inch gap on the bottom of the door.holes in comforter and drapes. Shower did not work. The place smells. If that is not enought we had toast for the continental breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Oh My God!”
Reviews.Author: GatersNTaters
Reviews.Content: I want to thank Expedia for booking me a hotel that deserves no stars. I hate you guys...yes, I really do! My girlfriend wouldn't even go into the shower. Did not sleep due to fear of bedbugs. What you see in the picture are the rooms around the pool (the only nice point in this crap hotel, but those are not the rooms you get. What you get is a ghetto room in an addition that should be torn down. The place is filthy, burn marks on the furniture, security door lock broke, sheets and towels are thread bare...all for $92.00. However, you do get a beautiful view of the Holiday Inn across the street so you can add insult to injury all night long. The place is gross, a total nightmare.

Reviews.Title: “Horror night”
Reviews.Author: sheoirse
Reviews.Content: Dirty and filthy hotel. very poor continental breakfast in the lobby, if I could name it so. Pretty rude staff.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go there - not worth for the $”
Reviews.Author: Pandaso
Reviews.Content: I agreed with the previous traveler's review. The staff at the front desk could have cared less. The room we had was smelly, musky, and dark. The room needs serious care and renovation. The staff never told us when to park in the back, so we had to haul all the luggage through the half of the hotel and climbed up one floor, while the back parking was right near the staircase. My friend decided to check out and we would have no money back at all, even we checked out at 5pm (20 minutes after we checked in). My friend and I went to the next block (literally) and checked in at the Holiday Inn Express when the staff was friendly and he gave us a good price (just perhaps $20-30 more than the Airway price). The Holiday Express was clean, tidy, and all that - almost from hell to heaven kind of feeling. There was another group of travellers inquirying when I checked out. The staff was telling them that all the hotel around here would be charging $200 etc. I almost wanted to tell them to come with me to the next hotel but I did not have a chance. I did wisher to one of them to take a look of the room first. Anyway, I would not recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely disgusting. do not stay here.”
Reviews.Author: travelgirl1984_10
Reviews.Content: When my friend and I arrived we were greeted by a less than friendly clerk, who when asked, told us that we couldn't have a room on the second floor because they were "full." The rooms are reached by a separate entrance to the street that DOES NOT LOCK (troublesome for two women traveling). The carpet in the hallway was stained, there was dirt in the bathroom, and there was no deadbolt on the door. Finally, and worst of all, we checked the beds for bedbugs and found some. We didn't even stay - we checked back out and went to another hotel nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Most Disgusting motel every - stay away!!!”
Reviews.Author: RitchiePooh
Reviews.Content: Do not even consider going to this dump, it needs to be demolished!! The building is falling apart, the rooms date back to the 1950's and have never been refurbished. We did not remove or shoes for fear of catching something from the floor. We booked it for one night en route from Miami home to catch an early flight next morning and could not sleep for fear of something crawling over us, we were afraid to use the bathroom, it was filthy, the bath tub was black and disgusting. The room door was so insecure anyone could have leaned on it and it would have fallen in!!

Reviews.Title: “Run As Fast As You Can...”
Reviews.Author: cubacruiser
Reviews.Content: We were storm stuck overnight and needed a place to get some sleep after our first long day sitting in the airport. We found this hotel on the bulletin board at the airport and thought we'd give it a try because it had a free shuttle, continental breakfast and the pictures of the hotel didn't look half bad. Well, truer words were never spoken, you do get what you pay for. It was HORRIBLE!!! Our room was called a "suite". ha ha ha First, we all had to pull our heavy luggage up the stairs and then when we saw the room, well...we should have left immediately. There were cracks all over the walls, the plaster was falling out, you could see mold, the carpet was old, dirty and torn!! The floors were slanted, paint was pealing and it smelled very musty. Although the door did lock, if you pushed on the door handle, you could move the door in and out. It would have taken one push of the hip to get it open, I am sure. We loaded three of our biggest suitcases up against it while we slept. I have to admit, we were one of those families that left within 15 minutes after getting up in the morning. We didn't even want to use the shower. We slept in our clothes and prayed we would stay alive until morning. Never again, never, ever again. It was a good lesson for me, spend a few extra bucks!! After spending a long day in the airport with hundreds and hundreds of other stranded passengers, little did I know that I'd look forward to going back to the airport the next morning. Even an airport was better than that hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here.”
Reviews.Author: TalofaSeattle
Reviews.Content: This is the worst place we have ever stayed. The hotel is shabby and the bathroom was in need of major repair. The hallway appeared not to have been cleaned for a while. The place was scary. On our return trip we went elsewhere and paid a few dollars more for a clean place in good repair.

Reviews.Title: “So bad we laughed and then cried.”
Reviews.Author: slader801
Reviews.Content: Shuttle was 15 minutes late at the airport. The hallway smelled like urine. Then the room had that awful smell, you know the really cheap motel one. The closet smelled like urine. The beds were the most uncomfortable I've ever experienced in my life. One bed had sand still in it!! (must not have changed the sheets) The a/c machine was never cleaned so we coughed from all the dirt blowing around. The whole place was a complete dump. I wouldn't pay over $10.00 for a place like that. The shower had hot water though. Probably the only thing it is good for is a hot shower. Don't plan on getting any sleep there. We started laughing because of all the problems and then felt like crap after we were forced to wake up at 6am because we got no sleep and couldn't sleep. I can't believe this place isn't bulldozed yet.

Reviews.Title: “Spend the extra ten dollars and go somewhere else.”
Reviews.Author: Amanda_09er
Reviews.Content: Absolutely disgusting. I wouldn't take my shoes off. I wouldn't take a shower. We just needed to be close to airport for a 5am flight, so I figured how bad could it be. The peole staying there were scary. We kept the lights on, I did not sleep at all I sat straight up on the bed and was careful not to touch the covers. Sleep in the airport it's safer and cleaner.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: CaribbeanChicabonita
Reviews.Content: First, we had waited at the airport for about an hour for the shuttle to pick us up before a shuttle driver from a nearby hotel who had seen us waiting for a long time took pity on us and took us to the hotel. As we pulled up, the shuttle driver from this hotel was strolling out the door with a cup of coffee. Then, I took the provided ice bucket to get some ice only to discover that the ice machine was broken (and looked like it had been for some time). I asked at the front desk where another one was, and was told there wasn't another one and I would have to wait until 11am when the restaurant opened and they could give me ice (11am is check-out time, at which point I wouldn't need any ice). Then to my surprise the free continental breakfast was only available from 8:30-9:30 (what about people who have early flights/meetings?) and consisted of bread, butter, tea, and coffee, with a toaster available. And that was it. None of the expected muffins, danishes, cereal, milk, juice, bagels, etc. There wasn't even any jelly! Just bread and butter. The room was okay, except the tub drained really slowly so that by the end of my shower I could have taken a bath in it (and there was no plug for the drain if I had wanted to take a bath), and the color on the TV was off so that all the people looked green. Oh, and I tried to call the front desk several times and never got an answer. Sure, it was a cheap bed for the night, but the customer service was terrible, and I don't think it is right of them to say they offer free breakfest when all that is available is buttered toast and coffee! Next time I'll shell out the extra 10 bucks for the Hampton.

Reviews.Title: “This is the third or fourth time I've stayed here.”
Reviews.Author: Musuru
Reviews.Content: It is a little old, with some wear and tear, but it's good value for money. The people are nice and some of the rooms have microwave ovens. It has a big pool. The hotel is very close to the airport. There is a bar and restraunt in the hotel and a McDonalds next door.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: BritColumbia
Reviews.Content: We were looking for an inexpensive place to sleep as we had a layover in Miami. Even though it was close to the airport, we waited over an hour for the free shuttle at 10:30 pm. Our expectations were not high but this place does NOT come with any referrals from us. OLD, UNKEMPT, RUN DOWN. The bed was clean and we had a decent sleep but couldn't wait to get out of there. Bathroom was a joke, like what you see in an old movie with a run down motel. We needed to take a 6:00 am shuttle back to the airport, which was prompt, but they would not accommodate any kind of breakfast as it does not open till much later! Not even juice or coffee! The front desk attendant was pleasant but you can find better deals than this. On the way back we had another lay over and choose to stay elsewhere for $20 more and it was worth every cent. Airways is a very LOW END hotel, does not even receive one star.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible - Nightmare from Hell...”
Reviews.Author: Adena
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for one night for an early flight the next day. The rate of $69 we were quoted was quickly increased to over $77 beacuse of extra parking, safe charges etc which were added onn with no opt-out option. The room was small, with only 1 double bed, unlike the standard twins you get elsewhere. The smoking room, which clearly stated NO SMOKING on the door, was positioned next to a night club on the other street, which didn't get going until 10pm, and then continued till 3am with the room banging and shaking to the live country and western music - NO JOKING!!! When we checked inn, we also asked to pay in cash, so we could use up the cash we had left, and was told by the female assistant just pay in the morning on check-out. When we finally arose to check-out, having no sleep till 3am, the manager just gave me the credit card receipt which had already been charged, and when I explained I wanted to pay cash, he abruptly replied I should have told him when I checked in. PS He only works in the mornings!!! Having now read the other reviews on this and all other hotels in Miami, I strongly recommend anyone who wishes to stay there, either pay for a 5 star, or dont bother!!!

Reviews.Title: “Airways Inn, a practical choice”
Reviews.Author: KentuckySailor
Reviews.Content: Yes, this property is run-down and it's not modern. So what? We just needed a bed for the night, a place to park our car for a couple of weeks and a ride to and from the airport. We could have stayed at the Holiday Inn Express right next door and paid a lot more for a place to sleep. That just doesn't make sense! I wouldn't choose this hotel for an extended stay, but for anovernight stay, it is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Not the Bellagio, but just perfect for us !!!”
Reviews.Author: Rap2k
Reviews.Content: Ok it's old, ok the bedrooms don't look great, the remote was not working, and the sink was not great. BUT ! For the four of us, 23 to 28 year old, the bedroom was huge with a seperation between the 2 beds, fridge and microwave a nice bonus, parking with camera and someone all night long (much better than a new bedroom for us) the lady at the entrance simply outstanding : knowledeable nice and efficient, the airport shuttle free, and every hour, a bus stop across the street, the swimming pool is definitely nice, located between a M fast food and a sport bar, everybody was happy, and we had the best price of all Miami through Orbits, with no surprise when checkin (no resort fee, or additional person, parking just 2.4$). The hotel is not new, but the housekeepers do a good job (except they woke me up every morning...). After all that we read we were scared but it was so much what we needed that we stayed our 3 last nights. Not a super nice resort to spend your vacation, but perfect to spend a couple of days waiting for your planes.

Reviews.Title: “not that bad”
Reviews.Author: tourdesagnard
Reviews.Content: when we first read the rewiew, we thought of going somewhere else. But we have just traveled 4 months in Asia and we don't want to spend too much money. But at the end, the stay was really ok. We stayed one night and the room was really ok, just the smell of the AC was a little bit strong. Yes, they're not really in a hurry to pick you up, yes there's only one shuttle per hour to go back to the airport and the breakfast is really poor and only from 8.30 to 9.30. But it's the cheapest hotel around the airport, and just to sleep it's ok.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Book this Hotel--YOU WILL REGRET IT”
Reviews.Author: HostessPlanner
Reviews.Content: Do not book with this hotel. Especially for group bookings. I did a group booking for a pre-cruise one-night stay with this hotel in 10/07 for a reservation in 4/08. Additional reservations couldn't be made because of problems with their website and hotel staff stating their was no reservation to add on to. Their website was non-functional for 2 weeks and for an additional 4 weeks the manager of the hotel was never available to receive phone calls and never returned any calls. Requests for cancellations resulted in being told that a reservation couldn't be cancelled if it doesn't exist. An in-person visit to this run-down hotel didn't resolve the problem (and of course, the manager wasn't there again). 10 days before the cruise, and 10 days before the day that was booked (if we were going to stay there), this hotel without authorization charged my card for the 10 rooms, This is dispite the fact that no credit card authorization form had been signed, a request to cancel the reservation had been stated in 11/07 and 12/07 (well before the 24-hour cancellation period, and that the staff repeatedly stated over a 6 month period that no reservation existed. So, if you want problems that cost you more than one-night than book here but if you do, based on my experience you will regret it. Please note that although my review may state that I stayed there, I actually did not but had to fill in the hotel stay section that couldn't be left blank because it is an area that you are required to fill in to post your reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Unkempt Hotel”
Reviews.Author: worldwidewanderer_8
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in desprate need of maintence. I'm appalled that the owners would leave it in this condition! Its very cheap, but there are cracks in the walls, the shower curtain rod was taped to the wall, the sink and toilet and bathtub had been painted and then was peeling, the bathroom tiles were scary, the pillows were VERY LUMPY and uncomfortable, the carpet was dirty (old stains) and I was thankful my dad was staying with me, or I would have been worried. I requested a new pillow but the maid had said that the order which arrived "last week" suddenly disappeared.... hmmmm. Really this should be your very last choice, spend the extra $25 and upgrade to a better hotel. PS-- Continental B'fast was white and brown bread and coffee/tea. Not impressive.

Reviews.Title: “AWFUL -- Definition of a SLUM!”
Reviews.Author: yo_bman
Reviews.Content: This place is the definition of AWFUL. We booked it in total desperation and sight unseen due to a missed connecting flight during spring break. I'm embarrassed to say we paid the same rate here as we did at the Four Seasons a few weeks earlier ($385 + tax). No we're not Four Seasons snobs, it was a special occasion for one night in L.A. Rooms at Airway Inn and Suites are truly the most disgusting any of us had ever seen. We're talking gum on the wall, cracked ceilings, and moldy tubs. We laid the airline blankets down on top of the bed (thank God we kept them). Urine smells reek throughout the hallways. Truly a SLUM! When we went down to complain about the room conditions and rates, of course the manager just happened to leave town for the week. Amazing -- he was there when we checked in 10 minutes earlier. Since they don't post their rates anywhere on the web or in writing, we called back to check rates for the following weekend out of curiosity -- same room we paid $385 for was now $87. They totally took advantage of a plane full of us who missed our connections due to airline mistakes. Had we seen the place before booking, I would have paid $87 to rent a car, drive as far away from it as possible, and sleep in a parking lot! The only saving grace is that we got there after midnight and had a 6 am flight. Anything longer would have been too much to handle. SLEEP IN THE AIRPORT OR RENT AN R.V. BEFORE EVEN CONSIDERING AIRWAY INN AND SUITES! Horrible, horrible, horrible!

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT stay here!!!”
Reviews.Author: ilovesunshine08
Reviews.Content: Please take this review seriously and do NOT stay here. My friend and I (both 22 years old) thought we could handle the hotel because we are in college and are used to cheap and bad living situations but this is unlike anything we could have imaged. The hotel is in a scary area, right off the main highway by the airport and planes fly overhead constantly, both day and night. We booked the hotel by phone 5 days before staying there because the hotel we had previously booked was too far away from the airport to catch our 6 AM flight. They took down the reservation and gave me a confirmation number and we hopped on our cruise without a worry in the world. When our cab dropped us off at the hotel at the end of the cruise, the man at the front desk told us that someone had canceled the reservation at 4 the same day we booked it, which was impossible because we were on the cruise at that point. He was not able to give us the room at the price we had first gotten the room at, which was $75 so then it became $86 and with taxes the final cost was $100. Then to store your bags while you lay at the pool is $2 per bag, a fee he so kindly waved because of their mistake with the room, but they never actually admitted it. When we were finally able to check in, the first room they gave us the keys would not work and the maid let us in. The room was very small, the carpet was stained and worn and had a dirty feeling to it. The bathroom was worse than a bathroom in a college house the day after a house party. We decided to ask for a second room at this point. The second room was a little better, the carpet wasn't quite as dirty and it felt safer because it was on the second floor but the drain in the shower was rusted out and the shower floor was stained and the tile was discolored. I never took my shoes off in the room, even to shower. The bed wasn't too bad, comfort wise but the sheets felt damp. The shuttle would only take you to the airport on the hour and the driver didn't help load the bags into the van at the hotel but then insisted on taking them out of the van for you, thinking you should tip him at that point. We were told by other people that the breakfast only ran from 8:30-9:30 and consisted of two types of bread but no toaster and jams and only had coffee to drink. Overall it was a scary experience, especially for two girls by themselves. I would not ever recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Lower End Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Supercilious
Reviews.Content: I stayed here because I was coming in late in the evening and had to catch an early morning flight. I didn't want to spend $100 plus for a room that I was going to be in for less than 8 hours. This place is right on NW 36th across from the airport. I had a corner room right on the street but with the windows closed, it was not that noisy. The room was pretty nice and very clean. The TV worked and there was a microwave and fridge. The bathroom was OK but there was no place to put your toilet kit. The shower worked well the night I arrived but the next morning, I could not get any hot water and I let the water run the whole time I was shaving. The hotel itself looks like an old dormitory and has an institutuion feel to it. It might be very depressing for many travelers. It seems that this place is frequented by patrons on the lower end of the economic spectrum. Although clean, there were some peanut shells on the floor of my stairway that were never cleaned up during my stay. There is a nice pool just off the loby in a courtyard. This might be nice on a warm afternoon or evening. I booked the hotel online for $59 for a single. With taxes and a mandatory safe fee of $1.75 and a parking fee of $2, the room came to $70 for the night. The restaurant at the hotel is closed but there is a McDonalds next door. One word of caution not releated to the hotel. I found it very difficult to find the car rental returns off of Le Jeune Road due to a lot of construction going on near the airport. I recommend calling your rental agency and getting detailed directions to their location from the hotel if you stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here! Again Do not stay here!”
Reviews.Author: yamasan
Reviews.Content: This is the awful and terrible hotel in the world. I followed the front desk instruction for shuttle bus, because my flight was late. The front desk told me to pick me up. so I waited for the shuttle bus for a long time during midnight. But the shuttle bus never come to the airport. 2:00 AM, I went to this hotel by taxi.... And there is a shuttle bus in front of the hotel.....without driver... I saw a creepy guy in the front desk....

Reviews.Title: “had a nice stay”
Reviews.Author: andistorme
Reviews.Content: I don't understand all those that had a bad visit. I stayed for 10 days and I found the staff very helpfu and friendly. My room was clean and the cleaning staff check on me every day to see if I needed anything during my stay. This is the second time I have stayed here and I will be in the future again. Everyone I talked to was friendly to me maybe it is the attitude of some of these customers that need to be checked and not the staff. You should also check out Tom's Sports Bar they have great food and are very friendly also.

Reviews.Title: “lolololol!”
Reviews.Author: hot
Reviews.Content: The first reviewer does not tell the truth. Must be a motel employee. Note he/she is from Miami Springs, and can only go there to cool out??!! Puleeze!! Everything else appears true. It looks ok on the board at the airport, but take everyone's advice and avoid this place. Only consider it if you have a pair of slippers to shower in, and something to lie on, and you are quite desperate, so desperate, very desperate, extemely desperate, you know, cant do ANY better type of desperate. Did I say only if you are desperate? Yes, very much so, desperately desperate. Get my Point? Hope so.

Reviews.Title: “Crappy Motel”
Reviews.Author: triniclaire
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not updated as they've noted. The carpet in the hotel rooms are very dirty & we were even scared to sleep on the beds. The customer service was horrible & the shuttle service attendant made no effort to help with the luggage. Upon arriving at the port he was demanding a tip even though we had put the tip already in his cup that was located in the front by the wheel. Next time I will pay for a more expensive hotel rather than this nasty motel.

Reviews.Title: “Only if your desperate!”
Reviews.Author: IrishEyesSmiling
Reviews.Content: We had to stay in Miami due to a missed flight. Money was tight and this was the cheapest place we could find. If its just a bed and no more you want then it will do the job. Bathroom was tiny, but wasn't adventerous enough to attempt a shower. Complimentary shuttle to airport. Place smelt very very musty and steps up to the first floor felt like they would collapse. We passed the opn door to the kitchen of the bar attached to the hotel and after that no way were we going to eat or drink in there. Staff were friendly enough and little shop in hotel that sold "essential stuck in Miami with no bag and have no choice but to pay these prices items".

Reviews.Title: “better than nothing”
Reviews.Author: tbruce1701
Reviews.Content: Well, the price was right for the day and season. Had to wait an hour to be picked up at airport. Room was something out of the fifties, not updated much at all. the bed did sleep well. room was mostly clean. hall ways are differant levels, so my bags kept falling off the carts at every bump. Pool area was the best part. Had free ride to port but employees say they will take u at 9:30, 10:30, 0r 11:30Am, but actually ONLY at 11:30Am. Some times the driver will help u with bags sometimes not. The driver did help from the airport, but I had to load them into the van to go the Port. I wouldn't use this hotel again, unless u do need to save the $. It will do if nothing else available, also a McDonalds right next door. I did notice that some airline people used this hotel, maybe they had better rooms for them.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all cost!!...Sleep at the airport!!”
Reviews.Author: shawnie
Reviews.Content: OMG...This place was the most awful place I've ever had to stay!! We had missed our connection in Miami enroute to Jamaica due to a late departure from New York and had to spend the night in Miami. Because of late flights coming into Miami from all over the U.S many people became stranded and needed accomodations. After calling just about every airport hotel on the hotel board in the airport this place was the only one available so we had no choice. When we arrived at the hotel I was totally sickened but what choice did I have. Trying to find our room was a obstacle in its self. The real horror began when I entered the room. It was disgustingly filthy, hair in the beds, dustballs and little creatures crawling everywhere. The bathroom looked like a scene out of the movie Texas Chainsaw Massacre. To me it looked like dried blood running down the walls and the medicine cabinets, well I won't even try to figure out what was growing in there. After travelling all day and with no other choice I decided to go to bed sleeping with my clothes on, on top of the bed with a large beach towel between me and the bedspread. Thank God when my alarm went off the next morning. Not that I got any sleep because I stayed awake all night making sure nothing crawled over me and listening to the planes take off right out side my door. When they say its an airport hotel they aren't lying. Its literally on the runway. When the planes took off you pretty much had to hold on to something to avoid being shaken out of your bed. No Joke!! 6am the next morning I was out of there. Straight to the airport for my 10am flight. The worst part of this ordeal was the fact that I got charged $170.00 for a night at the bates motel. They sure know how to get people when they know their stranded. I'm not a picky person. All I ask is for a clean place to lay my head and I certainly didn't get it here. All in all, it was a terrible experience that I can laugh at now even though it was only two weeks ago and the fact that I a wonderful time in paradise, but please, if you ever fall into a situation where you need to find a place in Miami close by the airport DO NOT STAY HERE!!

Reviews.Title: “Okay for a tight budget”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Airways Airport Inn and Suites in Miami was an okay hotel (some might consider this too description generous). The room was a fair size with queen size bed and very small bathroom. It wasnâ€™t very nice looking, but the bathroom was clean, the bedsheets smelled fresh, and the air-conditioner was awesome. The walls could have used a fresh coat of paint, and the t.v. wasnâ€™t very good. The pool and pool area looked very nice (too nice compared to the rest of the hotel) although I didnâ€™t have time to go for a swim. The front desk staff was very friendly (allowed me to store my luggage the next morning for free even though they were suppose to charge me 2$ per bag). I got a prompt pick up from the airport (free shuttle) although there was an 8$ per person charge for the shuttle to the port (when I reserved I was told it was free). There is a McDonaldâ€™s and subway, right next door, but not much else around.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at the Airways Hotel last night (4/10/04). It reminded me of one of those dirty motels that are always on COPS. The place smelled like urine, the rooms were dirty, and it was all-around crappy. The people were rude at the desk, and could hardly speak english. At the end of a long, smelly hallway was our equally smelly and dirty room. The bed sheets were itchy and dirty-looking, and there were only 2 towels for a suite. There was a divider in between the beds, and there was only one TV for both sides. The wires on it were exposed, with no wall plate covering it (not to code). Late at night, someone was jiggling our door handle, so we placed our baggage in front ouf the door. We had to wake up early for a flight(5 AM), and the free shuttle to the airport was a joke. When the van showed up, the driver was drunk. He stumbled from the van, opened the back door, and went into the hotel lobby bathroom. We had to load our own bags, and it took him at least ten minutes to return. We arrived, luckily, on time, and unloaded our own bags on the airport curb. Although the brand name hotels charge more, stay at them. Pay for the safe shuttle and a good night's rest. THE AIRWAYS IS GARBAGE. DO NOT BOOK THERE!

Reviews.Title: “Very bad experience!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night on Saturday, March 13, 2004. Couldn't believe how filthy and rundown this place was. I booked the room directly through their web site for about $60. (I called via phone, but they quoted an even higher price) When I got there, I found out that room prices were $30-$40. If it wasn't because my husband and I were dead tired from a long trip and it was Calle Ocho weekend so there was not a room available anywhere, I would have never stayed here. But, we had no choice - it was either sleep in the room or the car. To begin, hallways were filthy dirty, hotel looked very old and rundown. Very bad odor. Our room was worst. We were afraid to touch anything! The sheets were never changed and had a bad smell, so we slept with our clothes on (not even pjamas) and no did not use the sheets to cover us. The TV base was laying on the floor broken when we walked in. Since we were near the airport, there was a lot of noice from planes and the cars. When we paid via credit card for the room at the front office, the clerk wanted me to sign a blank receipt with no quantity on it - leaving us with an impression that these people were not too honest. We had to pay $2 for parking - it should have been free! We complained about the condition of our room and were only given a $10 discount. If you're looking for a half decent clean room, do not come here!!! In a nutshell, this was a rat hole.

Reviews.Title: “I Felt Like I was at Home”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A friend of mine came to town and I decided to keep her company. Let me just tell you that I really enjoyed the room we had. It was great. It was the normal, no suite. Yet I felt extremely comfortable. Whenever I just want to get away I go to this hotel to relax. The people at Front Desk are really friendly and Housekeeping respected the little sign on the door. I just want to tell you, keep up the good work because I'll be visiting more often. Also, the fact that you have Tom's Grill right there is great. :)

HotelInfo.Name: Airways Inn & Suites
